quest.name: A Tearful Reunion
journal: Cerigg worries for Taynor, who has been acting strangely of late.

Though Taynor remains singularly focused on the confrontation ahead, Cerigg is concerned that the boy may be suppressing his true emotions. The bounty hunter asks you to have a talk with your young companion─one mage to another─that you might help him work through any lingering anxiety or fears.

You speak to Taynor, who confesses that he harbors a deep-seated fear that he might falter in battle, condemning you and Cerigg to a grim fate in the void. Through your heartening words, the child is able to realize that the burden is not his to shoulder alone, and thus regain a measure of confidence. Together, you decide to return to Cerigg and inform the bounty hunter that all are now ready to face the final confrontation.

You and Taynor reconvene with Cerigg, and all present reaffirm that the time has come to take on Phronesis once and for all. From here, you and your companions decide to make for the Central Hills of Amber in Amh Araeng, where Taynor will work his magicks to summon your foe to battle.

Though the battle was a harrowing one, you and your companions have emerged victorious─Phronesis will terrorize the people of Amh Araeng no more. Bear witness to the sin eater's final moments, and pray that the soul of Taynor's old friend will find peace.

In the sin eater's last moments, Nyelbert's memories manifest themselves, revealing how the archmage continued to search for a way to bring his friend back from beyond the rift until the very end of his days. Taynor looks on in tears as his old friend laments his failure, and offers words of comfort in the vain hope of freeing him from his torment. Whether the result of the words reaching him or by sheer coincidence, the sin eater's form dissipates into innumerable motes of light, and is no more. Speak to Taynor, and lend your support to the boy in what is undoubtedly an emotionally trying moment for him.

Though it is unlikely that Taynor's heartfelt words truly reached his old friend, the experience nevertheless has allowed the boy to come to terms with his past, and with his own heretofore-conflicted feelings. Weary from battle, you and your two companions decide to return to Mord Souq to recuperate and reflect upon the experience you've shared.

Back at Mord Souq, Taynor expresses his gratitude for all that you and Cerigg have done for him, explaining that your adventures together have given him the confidence he needs to strike out on his own. Cerigg responds by inviting the boy to become his partner, and continue their adventure together, an offer which Taynor eagerly accepts. Your two companions invite you to join them at the Crystarium for a final farewell before you go your separate ways.

Back at the Crystarium, Cerigg and Taynor once more express their gratitude for all you have done for them. Cerigg vows to take good care of the boy, to show him the world and help him grow into his new life as a bounty hunter. Accepting your share of the reward for felling Phronesis, you wish your friends the best and strike off on your own, hoping deep down that your paths will cross again someday.
objectives: Speak with Cerigg at the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Warrior of Darkness.”

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Cerigg said that our fate in the battle against Ny─er, Phronesis depends on me. I will not...I cannot fail.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Well, look who's back─and looking more imposing than ever, I might add. You'll be pleased to know that Taynor's command of his magicks has advanced by leaps and bounds since you left. Says he's finally convinced he can hold his own against Phronesis.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I worry about the boy. As devoted as he is to his training, I can't help but notice a sad, uneasy look in his eyes from time to time. He insists it's nothing, of course, but I remain unconvinced.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: As a fellow mage, perhaps you could succeed in reaching out to him where I failed. He should be around here somewhere. Go and find him, and see if you can't offer him a few words of support, won't you?

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Taynor probably reckons that a muscle-headed bounty hunter like me couldn't understand the worries of mages─and hells, he's probably right. Would you be so kind as to go and talk to the boy for me? He should be around here somewhere...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Oh, hello there, Forename. Is there something I can do for you?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Cerigg was worried about me, you say? That is...kind of him. I assure you, I'm completely fine...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: I owe so much to the both of you. You brought me back from beyond the rift, took me under your wing...trained me and comforted me to the point that my memories and my magic have both returned. I am finally ready to face my old friend in battle...and it is all because of you.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: And yet, there is a fear growing inside me...a fear that threatens to consume me.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: In my studies, I have learned much about the sin eaters. I learned how those who fall to the most powerful sin eaters─like Phronesis─become sin eaters themselves, doomed to live out their days as mindless, unholy abominations.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: If I were to lose my focus in battle, and you or Cerigg suffered the same fate as Nyelbert...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: The only three friends I have known in this world... If I lost you all, how could I ever live with myself again!? This thought, it shakes me to my very core.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: If you falter, we will be there for you.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Worry not for us. Think only of Nyelbert.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: ...You are right. I mustn't forget that I have two strong friends by my side to help me shoulder the burden.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: So you are saying that I should free my mind of distractions, and focus on the task at hand?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Perhaps you're right. Worrying endlessly about things beyond my control will only serve to break my focus.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Thank you, friend. The task is a daunting one, but I will trust in myself─and in the strong and gentle friends who stand by my side.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Nothing would make me happier than to help Nyelbert find peace, but that is not the only reason I fight this battle. I must repay you and Cerigg for all you have given me.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Not only did the two of you bring me back to this world, you have instilled me with a newfound sense of purpose. And yet, when the battle is done, you will leave this place.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: You will embark on new adventures, with new companions. Worry not─I will not hold you back, or stand in your way.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: That is another reason I must fight this battle. I must prove to you─to all three of my friends─that I am strong enough to get by on my own.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Be strong, Taynor─you can do this! Er, sorry...perhaps I got a little carried away there. In any event, we should go tell Cerigg that I'm ready.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: I asked Cerigg what he intends to do after the battle is over, but he just scowled and told me to focus on the task at hand.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Do you think he's feeling sad about us splitting up, too? Er, d-don't tell him I said this, of course!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: You're finally back, I see. I was starting to get worried. I trust this means you're ready to do battle with Phronesis?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: I am! Let us put an end to this nightmare, and set Nyelbert and the people of this land free.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: That's the spirit! All right─the plan is to lure Phronesis to us by the same method as last time. We will venture to the Central Hills of Amber, a safe distance away from the city, and Taynor will summon forth a hollow. It should only be a matter of time before our quarry arrives.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: I believe our chances are best if we can lure Phronesis to a wide-open space, where we will have complete freedom to maneuver. The Hills of Amber should suffice. If you are ready, let us away at once.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: I couldn't be more proud of how much Taynor has grown since we first met him. Why, he's like the son I nev─ Ahem! Enough chitchat, eh? We have a battle to fight!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: ...I am ready. Let us begin.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Over there! It's him!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Yes...I knew you would come. Well, I guess we won't be needing this anymore...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Give it up, Nyelbert! My spells are more than a match for your own!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: These are my friends, and I will not let you take them! Do you hear me, Nyelbert? Your long nightmare─and ours─shall end this day!

dialogue.name: NYELBERT
dialogue.text: (-Nyelbert's Shade-)Forgive me, Taynor. Far and wide did I travel with my companions, all the while searching for a way─any way at all─to bring you back to this world. And yet, in the end, it was all in vain...

dialogue.name: NYELBERT
dialogue.text: (-Nyelbert's Shade-)Though I treasured the adventures I had with Ardbert and the others, my choice that fateful day forever haunted me. What if I had run off with the stone, and used its powers to rescue you as I had always intended? What adventures might we have shared?

dialogue.name: NYELBERT
dialogue.text: (-Nyelbert's Shade-)I sunk into the depths of despair, and felt myself a wretch for doing so. For by what right do I pity myself, when it was I who consigned you to far more cruel and tragic a fate?

dialogue.name: NYELBERT
dialogue.text: (-Nyelbert's Shade-)Whatever pain, whatever loss I knew is nothing compared to what you suffered─what you still suffer. Abandoned by your only friend, cast adrift in a cold, dark void until the end of time... Yes, no doubt you are still out there beyond the rift, cursing my name to this very day...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: That's not true, Nyelbert! I'm right here!

dialogue.name: NYELBERT
dialogue.text: (-Nyelbert's Shade-)And yet, even if you despise me with every fiber of your being... Even still, I would give anything to see you just one last time...

dialogue.name: NYELBERT
dialogue.text: You could curse me, revile me, rain fists and magicks down upon me... It would all be worth it, just for the chance to say...I am sorry...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: S-Stop it, Nyelbert! Please...stop saying those things...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Even after you had your mind, your heart, your very humanity ripped from you, still...still, for all these years, you kept searching for me!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: How could I ever hate my best friend?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Don't you see, old friend? It was Forename here who brought me back to this world, but it was you who guided herhim to me!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: You have suffered long enough, my friend. I can take care of myself now. You need worry about me no longer. So please...rest peacefully.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Call me crazy, but damned if the boy's words didn't actually get through to him.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: It's over...at last.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: ...You don't need to explain it to me. I know that the Nyelbert we saw was just a memory, a reflection from the crystal. That my friend truly passed years and years ago...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: And yet, even if those words will never reach Nyelbert, simply saying them aloud gave me a measure of peace. I have no regrets today.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: But we should be getting back to town before any more sin eaters take notice of us, yes?

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: I'll say. After that battle, I could use a rest─and I reckon Forename here could as well. Shall we head back to Mord Souq?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: We did what we had to do. I have no regrets.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't the womanman of the hour! I'm happy to report that tales of our triumph are already spreading across town like wildfire. Word has it the merchants are so grateful that they intend to sweeten the bounty with a generous personal reward.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: My friends...I have no words to express my gratitude.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Thanks to you, Nyelbert has found peace, and I can finally close the book on this chapter of my past. Every day, I thank the gods for having brought us together.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: The feeling's mutual, lad. To be honest, I wasn't sure what to expect when you popped out of that hole, but it's been a pleasure having you at our side.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: So, tell me. Now that you've made peace with your past, what do you plan to do with your future?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: You and Forename have trained me well, and I am quite confident that I can hold my own on the battlefield. Perhaps I will travel the land, and see if I might use my abilities to help those in need.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: If I didn't know better, I'd think those were the words of someone twice your age. If that's truly your intention, then I have something of a plan.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: First, I'll need Forename here's permission...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: It's just a thought I had, but...what say we give the lion's share of the bounty to Taynor here? I reckon he needs it more than we do, and besides, we couldn't have won the battle without him.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: But of course!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: ...You owe me one.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: I knew you'd feel the same. It's the least we can do to help the boy forge a path and a future for himself.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Ahaha! You're godsdamned right, I do! Any time you have need of a skilled marksman, you know where to find me. And don't you worry, there'll still be some coin left over for the both of us.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: My friends, I could never take advantage of your kindness like that...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Think nothing of it. It's not easy for a boy your age to make his way in the world, and this is the least we can do. Think of it as a parting gift from your brother- and sister-in-armsbrothers-in-arms.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Thank you, Cerigg. Thank you, Forename. As long as I live, I will never forget your generosity.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: ...Finally, I've one last proposal for you, if you're keen to hear it.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: There's this bounty hunter I know. He can hold his own with a bow, but he's always thought he could take on bigger marks if he had a skilled mage at his side. If you're looking for a partner, that is.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Cerigg...? You could not possibly mean...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: 'Course I'm saying it. So, what'll it be?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Yes, yes...a thousand times yes! Why, nothing would make me happier!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Then I suppose that settles it. Welcome aboard, lad. I've got a feeling that this is only the beginning of a rewarding relationship.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: And on that note, I do believe my new partner and I are off to the Crystarium to find ourselves a new mark.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: If it's not too much to ask, why don't you join us there? I still owe you your share of the bounty, and I reckon it'd be a good place to say our proper farewells.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: The path ahead will not be an easy one, but there is one thing I know: where I once feared the future, now I welcome it.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Glad you could join us. Taynor and I just arrived a short while ago ourselves. The boy's keen on starting his new life as a bounty hunter, to say the least.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: He's got no end of questions, that one. But there's only so much I can teach him─the rest he'll have to learn from experience. And so I intend to do what I can to show him the world...and keep him safe.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: So don't worry about us. Between my bow and his magicks, I reckon we'll be able to hold our own out there. That said, should we ever find ourselves on the trail of a particularly nasty foe, I hope you'd not be averse to lending us your strength once more.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Yes, somehow I have a feeling it won't take another hundred years for our paths to cross again. Until then, friend, stay sheltered in the shade.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Leave the hollow to me, and concentrate your attacks on our foe!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: You heard the boy! It's time to show this bastard what we've got!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Be wary, friends! He means to summon a hollow!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Keep a wide berth, friend, lest you get drawn into the void!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: I've done it! The hollow is sealed!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Good work, boy! Now stand back and save your strength! Our foe's got more tricks up his sleeve, no doubt...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Look out! Here comes another one!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Leave it to me, friends!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Watch out! Hurry to Cerigg's side, or you'll bear the full brunt of his magic!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: The bastard's trying to take us out in one fell swoop! Move away from me, and quickly!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: I've...<pant> <pant>...done it... The hollow is... <pant>

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Damn it! Are you all right, boy!?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Forgive me, friends... My strength is waning...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Looks like we're on our own until Taynor's strength returns! Stay clear of the hollows!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Good gods, but would you look at this one! Wait, perhaps we could use the hollows to our advantage...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Wicked white, the bastard's still going! Taynor, how do you fare?

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: ...I am fine. Leave the hollows...<pant>...to me!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: If even the empty shell of his body can work these magicks, I shudder to think of the powers Nyelbert commanded when he still lived...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: The sin eater's strength wanes! We mustn't let up the attack!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Yes, my friend... Soon, you will be at peace...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: I am sorry, my friends... I can summon no more strength...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: The boy has given us all he can. It falls to us to end the fight!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Again? Does he mean to cut off our escape route?

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: The bastard's found our weakness, and damned if he doesn't know what to do with it. We must hold our ground!

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: There's so many of them...! Forename, Cerigg...be safe!

dialogue.text: Damn it! It can't be over... Not like...this...
